acceptDefaultAdminTransfer().details: Completes a {defaultAdmin} transfer previously started with {beginDefaultAdminTransfer}. After calling the function: - `DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE` should be granted to the caller. - `DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE` should be revoked from the previous holder. - {pendingDefaultAdmin} should be reset to zero values. Requirements: - Only can be called by the {pendingDefaultAdmin}'s `newAdmin`. - The {pendingDefaultAdmin}'s `acceptSchedule` should've passed.

accrueInterest().details: Updates accumulators for all `ilk`s based on current interest rates.

returns.newTotalDebt: the new total debt after interest accrual

addOperator(address).details: Allows an `operator` to make unsafe changes to `_msgSender()`s positions.

returns._0: Whether or not an address is a supported collateral.

beginDefaultAdminTransfer(address).details: Starts a {defaultAdmin} transfer by setting a {pendingDefaultAdmin} scheduled for acceptance after the current timestamp plus a {defaultAdminDelay}. Requirements: - Only can be called by the current {defaultAdmin}. Emits a DefaultAdminRoleChangeStarted event.

borrow(uint8,address,address,uint256,byt.details: Allows a borrower to create debt in a position.

params.proof: merkle proof that the user is whitelist.

returns.newRateIncrease: the rate increase for the ilk.
returns.timestampIncrease: the timestamp increase for the ilk.

cancelDefaultAdminTransfer().details: Cancels a {defaultAdmin} transfer previously started with {beginDefaultAdminTransfer}. A {pendingDefaultAdmin} not yet accepted can also be cancelled with this function. Requirements: - Only can be called by the current {defaultAdmin}. May emit a DefaultAdminTransferCanceled event.

changeDefaultAdminDelay(uint48).details: Initiates a {defaultAdminDelay} update by setting a {pendingDefaultAdminDelay} scheduled for getting into effect after the current timestamp plus a {defaultAdminDelay}. This function guarantees that any call to {beginDefaultAdminTransfer} done between the timestamp this method is called and the {pendingDefaultAdminDelay} effect schedule will use the current {defaultAdminDelay} set before calling. The {pendingDefaultAdminDelay}'s effect schedule is defined in a way that waiting until the schedule and then calling {beginDefaultAdminTransfer} with the new delay will take at least the same as another {defaultAdmin} complete transfer (including acceptance). The schedule is designed for two scenarios: - When the delay is changed for a larger one the schedule is `block.timestamp + newDelay` capped by {defaultAdminDelayIncreaseWait}. - When the delay is changed for a shorter one, the schedule is `block.timestamp + (current delay - new delay)`. A {pendingDefaultAdminDelay} that never got into effect will be canceled in favor of a new scheduled change. Requirements: - Only can be called by the current {defaultAdmin}. Emits a DefaultAdminDelayChangeScheduled event and may emit a DefaultAdminDelayChangeCanceled event.

returns._0: The amount of collateral `user` has for collateral with index `ilkIndex`.

confiscateVault(uint8,address,address,ad.details: This function foregoes pausability for pausability at the liquidation module layer

params.changeInCollateral: collateral to add or remove from the vault
params.changeInNormalizedDebt: debt to add or remove from the vault
params.u: user to confiscate the vault from.
params.v: address to either credit `gem` to or deduct `gem` from

returns._0: The total amount of debt.
The debt ceiling for collateral with index `ilkIndex`.

defaultAdmin().details: Returns the address of the current `DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE` holder.

defaultAdminDelay().details: Returns the delay required to schedule the acceptance of a {defaultAdmin} transfer started. This delay will be added to the current timestamp when calling {beginDefaultAdminTransfer} to set the acceptance schedule. NOTE: If a delay change has been scheduled, it will take effect as soon as the schedule passes, making this function returns the new delay. See {changeDefaultAdminDelay}.

defaultAdminDelayIncreaseWait().details: Maximum time in seconds for an increase to {defaultAdminDelay} (that is scheduled using {changeDefaultAdminDelay}) to take effect. Default to 5 days. When the {defaultAdminDelay} is scheduled to be increased, it goes into effect after the new delay has passed with the purpose of giving enough time for reverting any accidental change (i.e. using milliseconds instead of seconds) that may lock the contract. However, to avoid excessive schedules, the wait is capped by this function and it can be overrode for a custom {defaultAdminDelay} increase scheduling. IMPORTANT: Make sure to add a reasonable amount of time while overriding this value, otherwise, there's a risk of setting a high new delay that goes into effect almost immediately without the possibility of human intervention in the case of an input error (eg. set milliseconds instead of seconds).

depositCollateral(uint8,address,address,.details: Moves collateral from `gem` balances to internal `vault.collateral`

params.proof: merkle proof that the user is whitelisted.

returns._0: dust amount for collateral with index `ilkIndex`.
Amount of `gem` that `user` has for collateral with index `ilkIndex`.

getCurrentBorrowRate(uint8).details: Gets the current borrow rate for borrowing against a given collateral.

returns._0: The address of the collateral at index `ilkIndex`.
The index of the collateral with `ilkAddress`.

getRoleAdmin(bytes32).details: Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}.

returns._0: The total amount of collateral in the pool.

implementation().details: Address of the implementation. This is stored immutably on the implementation so that it can be read by the proxy.

initializeIlk(address).details: This function and the entire protocol as a whole operates under the assumption that there will never be more than 256 collaterals.

returns._0: The address of interest rate module.
Whether or not `operator` has permission to make unsafe changes to `user`'s positions.
Whether or not `operator` is an `operator` on `user`'s positions.
The timestamp of the last rate update for collateral with index `ilkIndex`.

mintAndBurnGem(uint8,address,int256).details: To be called by GemJoin contracts. After a user deposits collateral, credit the user with collateral internally

normalizedBalanceOf(address).details: Accounting is done in normalized balances

returns._0: The amount of normalized debt `user` has for collateral with index `ilkIndex`.

pause().details: Pause actions but accrue interest as well.

paused().details: Returns true if the contract is paused, and false otherwise.

pendingDefaultAdmin().details: Returns a tuple of a `newAdmin` and an accept schedule. After the `schedule` passes, the `newAdmin` will be able to accept the {defaultAdmin} role by calling {acceptDefaultAdminTransfer}, completing the role transfer. A zero value only in `acceptSchedule` indicates no pending admin transfer. NOTE: A zero address `newAdmin` means that {defaultAdmin} is being renounced.

pendingDefaultAdminDelay().details: Returns a tuple of `newDelay` and an effect schedule. After the `schedule` passes, the `newDelay` will get into effect immediately for every new {defaultAdmin} transfer started with {beginDefaultAdminTransfer}. A zero value only in `effectSchedule` indicates no pending delay change. NOTE: A zero value only for `newDelay` means that the next {defaultAdminDelay} will be zero after the effect schedule.

returns._0: The rate (debt accumulator) for collateral with index `ilkIndex`.

removeOperator(address).details: Disallows an `operator` to make unsafe changes to `_msgSender()`s positions.

renounceRole(bytes32,address).details: See {AccessControl-renounceRole}. For the `DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE`, it only allows renouncing in two steps by first calling {beginDefaultAdminTransfer} to the `address(0)`, so it's required that the {pendingDefaultAdmin} schedule has also passed when calling this function. After its execution, it will not be possible to call `onlyRole(DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE)` functions. NOTE: Renouncing `DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE` will leave the contract without a {defaultAdmin}, thereby disabling any functionality that is only available for it, and the possibility of reassigning a non-administrated role.

repay(uint8,address,address,uint256).details: Allows a borrower to repay debt in a position.

repayBadDebt(address,uint256).details: To be used by protocol to settle bad debt using reserves NOTE: Can pay another user's bad debt with the sender's asset

params.rad: amount of debt to be repaid (45 decimals)
params.user: the address that owns the bad debt being paid off

rollbackDefaultAdminDelay().details: Cancels a scheduled {defaultAdminDelay} change. Requirements: - Only can be called by the current {defaultAdmin}. May emit a DefaultAdminDelayChangeCanceled event.

returns._0: The spot oracle for collateral with index `ilkIndex`.

supply(address,uint256,bytes32[]).details: Allows lenders to deposit their underlying asset into the pool and earn interest on it.

params.amount: of underlying asset to use to create the position.
params.proof: merkle proof that the user is whitelisted.
params.user: the address to receive credit for the position.

returns._0: The total amount of normalized debt for collateral with index `ilkIndex`.
The total amount of unbacked debt.

transferGem(uint8,address,address,uint25.details: Transfer gem across the internal accounting of the pool

returns._0: The amount of unbacked debt `user` has.

unpause().details: Unpause actions but this will also update the `lastRateUpdate` to the unpause transaction timestamp. This essentially allows for a pausing and unpausing of the accrual of interest.

updateIlkDebtCeiling(uint8,uint256).details: Updates the debt ceiling for a given collateral.

updateIlkDust(uint8,uint256).details: Updates the dust amount for a given collateral.

updateIlkSpot(uint8,address).details: Updates the spot oracle for a given collateral.

params.newSpot: address of the new spot oracle.

updateInterestRateModule(address).details: Updates the interest rate module. There is a check to ensure that `collateralCount()` on the new interest rate module match the current number of collaterals in the pool.

returns._0: All data within vault for `user` with index `ilkIndex`.
The total amount of ETH liquidity in the pool.
The supply cap for lenders.
The address of the whitelist.

withdraw(address,uint256).details: Allows lenders to redeem their interest-bearing position for the underlying asset. It is possible that dust amounts more of the position are burned than the underlying received due to rounding.

params.receiverOfUnderlying: the address to which the redeemed underlying asset should be sent to.

withdrawCollateral(uint8,address,address.details: Moves collateral from internal `vault.collateral` balances to `gem`

calculateRewardAndDebtDistributionForIlk.notice: This is primarily for simulation purposes to see how an individual ilk's state will change after an accrual.

initializeIlk(address).notice: Initializes a market with a new collateral type.

updateIlkDebtCeiling(uint8,uint256).notice: A market can be sunset by setting the debt ceiling to 0. It would still be possible to repay debt but creating new debt would not be possible.

updateIlkDust(uint8,uint256).notice: When increasing the `dust`, it is possible that some vaults will be dusty after the update. However, changes to the vault position from there will require that the vault be non-dusty (either by repaying all debt or increasing debt beyond the `dust`).

updateSupplyCap(uint256).notice: Reducing the supply cap will not affect existing deposits. However, if it is below the `totalSupply`, then no new deposits will be allowed until the `totalSupply` is below the new `supplyCap`.
